body.p:
Danville 11 July 1862
Govr McGoffen
Frankfort
Dr Sir

Wm Robbins was fined by the Police Judge of Danville $5. for giving (not selling) a dram of whiskey to one of My Mothers Slaves -- without her permission in writing. in Violation of one of the Town Ordinances.
The young man is very poor & laboring under a disease. His morals are I believe quite explenary -- and is trying very hard to make a living.

I believe in this case the fine ought be remitted. He will have to pay any how some
three Dollars 70 costs. enough for an act, the illegality of which he was imprisoned --

I might have been caught in the same predicament for I did not know of such an ordinace & I presume the young man did not. I do do think that not twenty men outside of the town officers know that such an ordinace exists --
I hope you will remit the fine & thus oblige

Danville Co Ct
$5 } Whiskey
Wm Robbins
Remission Issd July 22d 1862
